title: How to Submit a Mixed Inventory Fast
metaTitle: How to Sell Mixed Wine and Spirits Quickly | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Have a messy collection of wine, scotch, and tequila? Don't sort it for days. Learn our fast submission method using group photos.
summary: A fast submission method for mixed wine and spirits using batches, photos, and minimal formatting.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Mixed collections (e.g., 20 bottles of wine, 5 whiskeys, 2 tequilas) are tedious to list. Don't list them.
list: Group them physically on a table.
Take one clear photo of each group.
Count the total bottles.
Submit the photos with the note: 'Mixed lot, approx 50 bottles'.
We will zoom in and quote.

sections.heading: Sort by Category Only
content: Don't worry about vintage or region yet.
list: Pile A: Red Wine.
Pile B: White/Sparkling Wine.
Pile C: Spirits (Whiskey/Tequila/Cognac).
This helps us route the quote to the right expert (Wine vs Spirits desk).

sections.heading: The Group Photo Method
list: Line bottles up 3-deep on a table.
Ensure labels face forward.
Take a high-res photo from eye level (not top-down).
We can read the labels in the photo. This replaces the need for a typed list.

sections.heading: The 'Misc' Box
content: Every cellar has random low-value bottles.
list: Don't photograph every $10 bottle of Pinot Grigio.
Put them in a box and label it 'Misc Daily Drinkers'.
Tell us: 'Plus 3 cases of misc table wine'. We might offer a flat $5/bottle just to clear it, or tell you to donate it.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Typing a 50-page manifesto for $20 bottles.
Listing the alcohol volume instead of the vintage.
Ignoring the dusty boxes in the corner (which might have the best stuff).

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Set aside 15 minutes.
Line them up.
Snap photos.
Upload to our form.
Done.

faqs.question: Does my photo need to be professional?
faqs.answer: No. Smartphone photos are perfect. Just ensure good lighting.

faqs.question: What if I miss a bottle?
faqs.answer: We confirm everything upon physical receipt. If we find extra bottles, we add them to the payment.
